label: A3B4_mC28_15_ef_2f-001
title: Monoclinic Ni$_{4}$B$_{3}$ Structure
comments:
Ni$_{4}$B$_{3}$ is found in two forms (Rundqvist, 1967): \begin{itemize} \item An \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B4_oP28_62_3c_4c-001}{orthorhombic structure}, and \item this \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B4_mC28_15_ef_2f-001}{monoclinic structure}. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 While the monoclinic structure is stoichiometric, with chains of boron atoms, the composition of the orthorhombic phase is Ni$_{4}$B$_{3-x}$, with vacancies on the boron sites.  The exact phase depends on the stoichiometry.
